attributes.action: Give UK nationals vaccine at arrival airport not bill for hotel quarantine
attributes.additional_details: To offer covid jabs at arrival airports and to get rid of the hotel quarantine part of this ongoing saga to enable those stranded to come home safe and sound.
attributes.background:
There are thousands of British nationals who have travelled to "red list " countries for vital reasons
Each will have PCR tests before coming back to the UK. So anyone with a negative test " should be allowed back to the Uk without having to self isolate in a hotel for 10 days .

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about existing travel restrictions, but it's not clear how offering people returning to the UK a Covid-19 vaccine could replace existing testing and self-isolation arrangements. Requirements for testing and self-isolation are intended to prevent onward transmission of Covid-19. Vaccination for Covid-19 takes time to be effective, and it is also not yet clear how vaccination effects onward transmission.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Review quarantine rules for international arrivals travelling for work: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/574771

No hotel quarantine for UK citizens, permanent residents and their families: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/571447
